MultiClass_CPILS moduleÔÉÅ

class MultiClass_CPILS.MultiClass_CP_ILS(bbox_model: BaseEstimator, train_set: DataFrame, test_set: DataFrame, bbox_structure: BaseEstimator, target_class: str = 'class', mode: str = '1v1')[source]ÔÉÅ

Bases: object

A multi-class extension of the CP_ILS method designed for binary classification.

This class handles multi-class classification scenarios by transforming them into binary classification problems in different modes. The supported modes include 1v1, 1vAll, 1vAll_Spec, Allv1, and All_Specv1, which specifies how the multi-class problem is decomposed into binary ones.

Constants:ÔÉÅ

MODE_1V1str

Constant representing the 1-vs-1 mode.

MODE_1VALLstr

Constant representing the 1-vs-All mode.

MODE_1VALL_SPECstr

Constant representing the 1-vs-All (Specific) mode.

MODE_ALLV1str

Constant representing the All-vs-1 mode.

MODE_ALL_SPECV1str

Constant representing the All-vs-1 (Specific) mode.

Attributes:ÔÉÅ

flattenfunction

A lambda function to flatten multi-dimensional arrays.

__mbbox_modelmodel

The multi-class black-box classifier model used for predictions, also referred as MBB

__train_setpd.DataFrame

The training dataset used to generate latent spaces.

__test_setpd.DataFrame

The test dataset used for validation and counterfactual generation.

__modestr

The mode of classification, which defines how the multi-class problem is treated.

__class_combinationslist

A list of class combinations generated according to the mode.

__dict_train_datasetsdict

A dictionary storing the training datasets for each class combination.

__dict_test_datasetsdict

A dictionary storing the test datasets for each class combination.

__dict_latent_spacesdict

A dictionary storing the latent spaces for each class combination.

__hex_colors_for_classesdict

A dictionary storing the hexadecimal colors for each class, used for plotting points with same class color in all exp.

cdist_sample_distance(XA: DataFrame, XB: DataFrame, metric=('euclidean', 'jaccard'), w: Any | None = None)[source]ÔÉÅ

The distance function used to measure the distance among to 2 distinct samples; the same used in original paper combining Hamming distance for categorical values and cosine distance for continous attribute. This method can be applied simultaneously to multiple points at time, returing a matrix of distances.

Parameters:

  • XA (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì representing the first sample instance, can be used with multiple rows

  • XB (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì representing the second sample instance can be used with multiple rows

  • metric (str) ‚Äì this is the criterion used for continuous and categorical variables

  • w (Any) ‚Äì The weight vector for metrics that support weights (e.g., Minkowski)

Returns:

a numerical array of distances accordingly to metric between XA and XB

Return type:

numpy.array

execute_ranking_of_counterfactuals(test_instance: DataFrame, df_counterfactuals: DataFrame, ranking: str = 'proximity', group_by_class: bool = True, top_k: int = -1)[source]ÔÉÅ

This function is used for ranking a list of counterfactuals related to a target test instance. It gives the possibility to rank counterfactuals per proximity or per probability class prediction.

Parameters:

  • test_instance (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì the instance related to the counterfactuals list, used to determine proximity

  • df_counterfactuals (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì the list of counterfactuals that needs to be ranked

  • ranking (str) ‚Äì the modality of ranking; proximity-> use the distance between the counters and the test_instance, accuracy pushes up the counterfactuals with higher prediction probability, default proximity

  • group_by_class (bool) ‚Äì specifies if the results are presented ranked per class or not, default True

  • top_k (int) ‚Äì specifies the number of counterfactulas to show at maximum in the final view

Returns:

It return a list of ranked counterfactuals accordingly to specified criterion.

Return type:

list

execute_testing_on_data(test_name, test_instances, change_f, max_f, filtering_mode='acceptable', debug=False)[source]ÔÉÅ

This function call iteratively the methods to generate the counterfactuals and save all the results on external files specified by input parameters, in order to make a post-hoc analyis of the goodness of used methods.

Parameters:

  • test_name ‚Äì the name to be used as suffix in the generation of the files

  • test_instances ‚Äì the list of instances involved during the test of the methods

  • change_f ‚Äì the list of feature that can be modifiable during the procedure of generation

  • max_f ‚Äì it is the maximum number of attribute that can be changed togheter from the change_f list

  • filtering_mode ‚Äì (optionally) it indicate the modality of possible filtering of counterfactuals ‚Äòacceptable‚Äô,‚Äôspecific‚Äô,default ‚Äòacceptable‚Äô

  • debug ‚Äì boolean value to print on console debug informations

generate_counterfactuals(test_instance: DataFrame, change_f: List[int], max_f: int, counter_classes: Any = -1, filtering_mode: str = '', debug: bool = True)[source]ÔÉÅ

Main function to generate counterfactuals for a specific instance. This function should be called after having trained all the latent spaces. Depending on the modality initially chosen, it applies the default generate counterfacutal method on each combination.

Parameters:

  • test_instance (pd.DataFrame) ‚Äì the instance interested in counterfactuals explanations

  • change_f (List[int]) ‚Äì the list of feature that can be modifiable during the procedure of generation

  • max_f (int) ‚Äì it is the maximum number of attribute that can be changed togheter from the change_f list

  • counter_classes (Any) ‚Äì it specify a list of possible classes values interested in generation of counterfactuals or -1 if all available

  • filtering_mode (str) ‚Äì (optionally) it indicate the modality of possible filtering of counterfactuals ‚Äòacceptable‚Äô,‚Äôspecific‚Äô

  • debug (bool) ‚Äì boolean value to print on console debug informations

Returns:

a list of counterfactuals grouped by class, cotaining information about all the generated, the predictions of the multi-class and binary classifiers and the filtered ones.

Return type:

list

generate_ls(latent_dim_k: int = 2, early_stop_param: int = 5, timer: bool = False)[source]ÔÉÅ

This method compute the latent spaces for all the combinations of classes according to the initial selected modality and using as training and testing dataset the specific prepared for each combination. For each combination, a new black box classifier is trained with the sub-selected training samples, then the CP_ILS classical method is called in order to build this specific binary latent space.

The results of binary black box, latent space and training values are saved into self.__dict_latent_spaces dict variable.

Parameters:

  • latent_dim_k (int) ‚Äì the dimension K of each generated latent space by default it is equal to 2

  • early_stop_param (int) ‚Äì the condition to avoid to generate too many iterations in case of no improvments, defulat 5 epochs.

  • timer (bool) ‚Äì boolean variable to take note of the time elapsed for training

get_ls_of_class(class_name: str)[source]ÔÉÅ

Method to return the latent space where the class with class_name is involved.

Parameters:

class_name (str) ‚Äì The name of the class to be reserched in latents spaces combinations

Returns:

A list of tuples, where each tuple contains a latent space key and its corresponding value,

filtered to include only those where class_name is present in the key.

Return type:

list

get_ls_of_not_class(class_name: str)[source]ÔÉÅ

Method to return the latent space where the class with class_name is NOT involved.

Parameters:

class_name (str) ‚Äì The name of the class to be researched in latent space combinations.

Returns:

A list of tuples, where each tuple contains a latent space key and its corresponding value,

filtered to include only those where class_name is NOT present in the key.

Return type:

list

  • class_name (str) ‚Äì the specific class involved in the combinatio to be plotted

  • class_name (str) ‚Äì the specific class involved in the combinatio to be plotted
